title: Custom dotted_pointer implementation
body:
`get_json_pointer` converted a dotted pointer to an slashed pointer for serde jsons `pointer`.
I replaced the used of `pointer(get_json_pointer())` with an implementation of `dotted_pointer` what reduced a lot of allocations

as `get_json_pointer` was hidden, but a public function (for benchmarks), I marked it as deprecated.

benchmarks got replaced by a benchmark that uses `dotted_pointer` in a serde json value.

This improvement is not a breaking change.

Benchmarks before:
```
running 4 tests
test bench_big_loop_big_object                 ... bench:     184,662 ns/iter (+/- 2,075)
test bench_macro_big_object                    ... bench:     445,885 ns/iter (+/- 9,864)
test bench_macro_big_object_no_loop_macro_call ... bench:   1,052,077 ns/iter (+/- 152,796)
test bench_macro_big_object_no_loop_with_set   ... bench:   1,040,018 ns/iter (+/- 96,262)

test result: ok. 0 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 4 measured; 0 filtered out; finished in 10.07s

     Running benches/escaping.rs (target/release/deps/escaping-73cdee30956e38a2)

running 6 tests
test bench_escape_html_long         ... bench:         297 ns/iter (+/- 6)
test bench_escape_html_short        ... bench:         126 ns/iter (+/- 3)
test bench_escape_html_very_long    ... bench:       4,127 ns/iter (+/- 34)
test bench_escape_no_html_long      ... bench:         295 ns/iter (+/- 3)
test bench_escape_no_html_short     ... bench:          99 ns/iter (+/- 53)
test bench_escape_no_html_very_long ... bench:       2,374 ns/iter (+/- 48)

test result: ok. 0 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 6 measured; 0 filtered out; finished in 11.67s

     Running benches/json_pointer.rs (target/release/deps/json_pointer-82582d912d61dd99)

running 2 tests
test bench_get_json_pointer          ... bench:         114 ns/iter (+/- 6)
test bench_get_json_pointer_with_map ... bench:         566 ns/iter (+/- 9)

test result: ok. 0 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 2 measured; 0 filtered out; finished in 0.62s

test result: ok. 0 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 2 measured; 0 filtered out; finished in 3.20s

     Running benches/tera.rs (target/release/deps/tera-c384b6304625628d)

running 12 tests

test bench_rendering_only_parent               ... bench:         398 ns/iter (+/- 7)
test bench_rendering_only_variable             ... bench:         779 ns/iter (+/- 6)

test result: ok. 0 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 12 measured; 0 filtered out; finished in 7.48s
```

title: Faster get_json_pointer
body:
I improved the speed of get_json_pointer by preallocating the String

before:
test bench_get_json_pointer          ... bench:         114 ns/iter (+/- 5)
test bench_get_json_pointer_with_map ... bench:         568 ns/iter (+/- 10)

after:
test bench_get_json_pointer          ... bench:          92 ns/iter (+/- 3)
test bench_get_json_pointer_with_map ... bench:         434 ns/iter (+/- 13)

not a breaking change.

title: add abs filter
body: adds an abs filter for numbers

title: Fix deprecations & clippy::all
body:
fixes chrono, prec_climber and humansize deprecations
humansize is extended by the binary attribute (for jinja compatibility)
fixes clippy warnings and errors still maintaining MSRV 1.56
uses total_cmp instead of partialOrd implementation of f64

_I can't tell if updating the dependencies forces to use a newer MSRV._
Edit: tested with rust 1.56.0

title: Fix example for defining custom functions capturing external variables.
body: It took me quite a while to get this example right. LSP hints were quite confusing and pointed me towards `dyn Box`, however `impl` seems to do the trick.

title: Always canonicalize glob paths passed to Tera
body:
This is to work around an issue in globwalk (https://github.com/Gilnaa/globwalk/issues/28) due to which paths starting with `./` or `../` never match anything. A regression test has been added as well.

This fixes https://github.com/Keats/tera/issues/574.

title: Remove unused [badges] section in Cargo.toml
body: As per https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html#the-badges-section, that section is not used by crates.io anymore.

title: Title case filter with apostrophe (#771)
body:
Fixes #771

Tested locally with latest version and Rust on Windows 11. More tests may be needed.

title: Fix example of loop on maps
body: I suppose the example was duplicated from the simple for loop and the content block wasn't updated accordingly by mistake :)

title: Fix wrong type in `get_random` error message.
body:
Those errors are also reported for numbers overflowing an `i32` (e.g. `get_random(end=9999999999)`) which is also confusing, but less so than saying a boolean was expected.

All the other functions in this file seem to have the correct types reported.

title: Update pest deps to latest version
body: This PR updates the pest dependency version with the latest one (2.3.0)

title: Add cargo-deny
body:
- checks licenses, advisories (PR and cron periodically), advisories will not fail PR but cron will annoy about them

Uses Embark Studios cargo-deny GH Action

https://github.com/EmbarkStudios/cargo-deny-action

deny.toml can be adjusted for variety of things

title: eval_in_condition: Use safe_eval rather than eval (#738)
body:
Fixes #738

- Added two simple tests to ensure there isn't a regression
- The fix is simple though would appreciate a sanity check, specifically that calling `safe_eval_expression` in `eval_in_condition` can't result in safety issues
  - I don't believe it does but a double check from someone more familiarly with the codebase would be appreciated =]

title: feat(date): locale (#612)
body:
Adds optional `locale` argument in `date` filter, including doc and tests.

Notes:
* For some(?) reason, `chrono::NaiveDateTime::format_localized` does not exist, so timestamps without timezone cannot be localized.
* In order to avoid code duplication, `format_localized` is used event when a locale is not provided (using `chrono`'s default `POSIX`). Looking at `chrono`'s code, this should not affect performance.
* Adds `chrono/unstable-locales`, which may be heavy and restrict `chrono` versions. Should this be in a feature `date-locale`?

title: Upgrade chrono
body: Upgrade `chrono` the newly released version. I only ran `cargo test` and `cargo fuzz ...` (to be completely honest; it is still running) in order to check that everything still works.

title: docs: Improve clarity
body: Use the same syntax for both examples

title: better parenthesis support (#718)
body:
- overall math expression parehthesis
- better support for the order of math operations signified by the parenthesis

title: Hide uncompileable code examples from the "cargo test" output (#724)
Fix comment, it contained a typo and thus was less informative
Add links on more info about the pest grammar files
body: These links could encourage someone to dig deeper into how the parser works and they also could help with a slight confusion caused by built-in rules which nature is unclear.

title: Fix spelling mistake, other minor formatting improvements
Support supplying a timezone for timestamps
body:
While using the built-in `date` filter, a specific timezone can
only be set for ISO 8601 date strings. This commit makes it possible
to supply a timezone for i64 timestamps (seconds since epoch).

Example usage: `{{ 1648302603 | date(timezone="Turkey") }}`

Signed-off-by: Orhun Parmaksız <orhunparmaksiz@gmail.com>

title: Add feature for just the urlencode builtin
body: This way, I don't have to pull in a bunch of other dependencies that I don't need, but can still have the urlencode filter which I do need.

title: * slice filter: Return empty array if `start >= end`
body: Fixes #702
